intro: Delphinium iliense var. angustatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved delphinium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in dense spikes at the顶端 of the stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a finely toothed margin, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
